title: Urban agglomeration of Mont-Tremblant
text:
The Urban agglomeration of Mont-Tremblant is an <a href="Urban%20agglomerations%20in%20Quebec">urban agglomeration</a> in <a href="Quebec">Quebec</a> that consists of the city of <a href="Mont-Tremblant">Mont-Tremblant</a> and the municipality of <a href="Lac-Tremblant-Nord%2C%20Quebec">Lac-Tremblant-Nord</a>.
History.
As part of the <a href="2000%E2%80%932006%20municipal%20reorganization%20in%20Quebec">2000–2006 municipal reorganization in Quebec</a>, the city of <a href="Mont-Tremblant">Mont-Tremblant</a> was created on November 8, 2001 by the merger of the <a href="municipality%20%28Quebec%29">municipality</a> of Mont-Tremblant, the <a href="city%20%28Quebec%29">city</a> of Saint-Jovite, the <a href="parish%20municipality%20%28Quebec%29">parish municipality</a> of Saint-Jovite, and the <a href="municipality%20%28Quebec%29">municipality</a> of Lac-Tremblant-Nord. Following <a href="2004%20Quebec%20municipal%20referendums">a 2004 referendum</a> Lac-Tremblant-Nord de-merged and became an independent municipality again on January 1, 2006.
However, the legislation governing the de-merger process provided for the creation of a new municipal structure, an <a href="urban%20agglomeration%20%28Quebec%29">urban agglomeration</a>, which would continue to tie de-merged cities to their former partners for the provision of various municipal services.
